Sentence.value: Your health care provider may tell you to temporarily stop taking medicines that may affect the test results.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Your health care provider may tell you to temporarily stop taking [[medicines|C0013227]] that may affect the [[test results|C0456984]].

Sentence.value: These include: - Antibiotics - Antihistamines - Blood thinners, such as aspirin, that make it hard for the blood to clot - Nonsteroidal inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) Do not stop taking any medicine without first talking to your provider.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: These include: - Antibiotics - Antihistamines - [[Blood thinners|C0003280]], such as [[aspirin|C0004057]], that make it hard for the blood to clot - Nonsteroidal inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) Do not stop taking any medicine without first talking to your provider.

Sentence.value: It may also be ordered if a member of your family is known to have a bleeding disorder due to platelet dysfunction.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: It may also be ordered if a member of your [[family|C0015576]] is known to have a [[bleeding disorder|C1458140]] due to [[platelet dysfunction|C0679429]].

Sentence.value: The test can help diagnose problems with platelet function and determine whether the problem is due to your genes, another disorder, or a side effect of medicine.
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: The test can help diagnose problems with [[platelet function|C1254881]] and determine whether the problem is due to your [[genes|C0017337]], another disorder, or a [[side effect|C0879626]] of medicine.

Sentence.value: Decreased platelet aggregation may be due to: - Autoimmune disorders that produce antibodies against platelets - Fibrin degradation products - Inherited platelet function defects - Medicines that block platelet aggregation - Bone marrow disorders - Uremia (a result of kidney failure) - Von Willebrand disease (a bleeding disorder)
Sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Decreased platelet aggregation may be due to: - [[Autoimmune disorders|C0004364]] that produce [[antibodies|C0003241]] against platelets - Fibrin degradation products - Inherited platelet function defects - Medicines that block platelet aggregation - Bone marrow disorders - Uremia (a result of kidney failure) - Von Willebrand disease (a bleeding disorder)

annotation.surface-form: platelets - Fibrin degradation products - Inherited platelet function
